title: Numerals on fontsinuse.com
content:
Can anyone put a name to these numerals?

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130825213204im_/http:/f.cl.ly/items/1r413h1z192z0U0R1C1O/new-fiu-collection-by-the-numbers.png)
author: chrisburton

comments.content: Hah! Where did you find that image? It comes from webfonts used in [this post on Fonts In Use](http://web.archive.org/web/20130825213204/http:/fontsinuse.com/uses/39/100-days). The fonts aren’t loading at the moment as we’re updating the site. And, yes, it’s [Benton Modern Display](http://web.archive.org/web/20130825213204/http:/www.webtype.com/font/benton-modern-display-family-16-fonts/).

Hey, Stephen. I saw it on this post here: [http://fontsinuse.com/uses/1783/welcome-to-the-new-fonts-in-use](http://web.archive.org/web/20130825213204/http:/fontsinuse.com/uses/1783/welcome-to-the-new-fonts-in-use "http://fontsinuse.com/uses/1783/welcome-to-the-new-fonts-in-use") which is using an image (obviously) instead of markup in your link. So gorgeous.

Oops, I mistook it for the earlier post. OK.

Sorry to hear it was difficult to find the typeface name in that post. That’s what the site is all about!

I've been up for almost 24 hours otherwise it would have been quite obvious.

I mean, come on:

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130825213204im_/http:/f.cl.ly/items/1i03283v3b2R0N1v1O3H/Image%202013-05-20%20at%204.10.35%20PM.png)

How obvious can it get? Ha. Don't change a thing.
